intro: Sison alpinum, commonly known as the alpine sison, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Sison alpinum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local insect populations.
